areas.description: A small, sandy inlet littered with sea-glass and bleached driftwood. The starting point for 'Fisher'.
areas.story_progression: Introduces basic movement and the 'Fisher' identity. The player meets Dictys and completes a tutorial on net-casting.

areas.description: Sharp volcanic rocks that jut from the surf like teeth. Dangerous for ships and memories alike.
areas.story_progression: First combat zone. Fisher hunts 'Memory Predators' and finds the 'Fisherman's Hook' (Harpe) wedged in a sunken hull.

areas.description: A cozy, salt-encrusted shack where Perseus sleeps. It contains fragments of a life he doesn't remember.
areas.story_progression: The primary narrative hub for Chapter 1. Here, Perseus hears the first lullaby and finds the Locket of Braided Hair.

areas.description: A swirling pool that reveals ancient treasures only when the tide is exactly right.
areas.story_progression: The chapter climax. The Ark of Danae is revealed here, triggering the first major memory flashback and 'cleansing' the Harpe's name.

areas.description: A decayed wooden structure half-submerged in the turquoise water. Barnacles cover every pillar.
areas.story_progression: Perseus practices his combat skills against minor aquatic husks. He begins to feel his 'Titan-strength' returning as he lifts heavy debris.

areas.description: A labyrinth of tall sea-grass and shallow, briny pools where the air is thick with the scent of salt.
areas.story_progression: A stealth tutorial. Perseus must hide from a memory phantom that resembles his grandfather, Acrisius.

areas.description: An abandoned stone tower whose beam flickers with a ghostly blue light instead of fire.
areas.story_progression: Climbing challenge. At the top, Perseus sees a vision of the Gorgon's Lair, signaling that his journey must leave Seriphos.

areas.description: A workspace filled with large wooden looms and mountains of coarse hemp netting.
areas.story_progression: Dictys reveals that he knew Perseus was a prince all along, but kept it secret to protect him from the Titan's gaze.

areas.description: A hidden cave behind a waterfall where a soft golden glow emanates from the damp stone walls.
areas.story_progression: Narrative beat where Perseus finds a discarded gold leaf, triggering a memory of his mother’s voice describing his father, Zeus.

areas.description: A narrow cliffside path used by those who wish to avoid the main roads of the island.
areas.story_progression: The exit from Chapter 1. Perseus uses the Harpe to cut through a wall of memory-mist, revealing the path to the Whispering Woods.

areas.description: A twisted thicket where light is consumed by the canopy. Phantoms of petrified victims wander the paths.
areas.story_progression: Perseus follows 'The Echo' (Andromeda) through stealth sections. He must use the Aegis as a signal tool.

areas.description: A bleak, rocky beach where the sound of the ocean is drowned out by a low, rhythmic breathing.
areas.story_progression: Boss Arena. Perseus fights the shadow of Cetus. Defeating the beast makes Andromeda physically visible.

areas.description: A stagnant pond that reflects a distorted, vain version of whoever looks into it.
areas.story_progression: Narrative beat where Perseus meets Cassiopeia and learns of the 'Original Sin' of the family.

areas.description: Trees here have branches that behave like grasping fingers, snaring anyone who moves too quickly.
areas.story_progression: Traversal puzzle. Perseus must time his movement to avoid being rooted in place by the forest.

areas.description: The upper layer of the forest where the wind whistles through hollow bark like a thousand screaming voices.
areas.story_progression: Vertical platforming. Perseus begins to suspect the forest itself is a memory of the screams of the petrified.

areas.description: A crumbling stone platform overlooking the dark ocean, stained with ancient brine.
areas.story_progression: Perseus finds a shard of an old trident, sensing the influence of Poseidon in his amnesia.

areas.description: Massive subterranean roots that pulse with a sickly purple light.
areas.story_progression: Combat gauntlet. Perseus must destroy 'Root Cores' that are feeding on his lost memories of Andromeda.

areas.description: A rare open space where white petals fall constantly, masking the presence of predators.
areas.story_progression: Andromeda speaks her first words to Perseus, reminding him that he saved her once before.

areas.description: A paved stone road half-swallowed by the forest, leading toward the underground.
areas.story_progression: Hermes leaves a trail of feathers that lead Perseus away from a Titan ambush.

areas.description: A swampy transition zone where the forest sinks into the earth. The air is freezing.
areas.story_progression: Perseus finds a tunnel entrance. He realizes the Graeae are waiting for him below.

areas.description: A corridor of sheer stone where every footstep echoes as a different person's voice.
areas.story_progression: Introduction to the 'Sound Navigation' mechanic. Mnemosyne's voice tries to lead the player into pitfalls.

areas.display_name: The Chamber of the Single Eye
areas.description: A circular room filled with ancient dust and the smell of copper.
areas.story_progression: Puzzle Boss fight with the Graeae. Perseus must steal the eye to light up the caverns.

areas.description: A cold underground river that flows toward the underworld.
areas.story_progression: A stealth section using the newly found Helm of Darkness to pass through a gate of ghosts.

areas.description: A maze where the sound of Perseus's own heartbeat becomes a deafening drum.
areas.story_progression: Perseus must maintain his 'Sanity Gauge' as Mnemosyne tries to convince him his quest is futile.

areas.description: A deep crack in the earth where all sound is instantly absorbed.
areas.story_progression: Platforming challenge. Without sound cues, the player must rely purely on visual timing.

areas.description: A grotesque 'living room' filled with piles of discarded memories from other heroes.
areas.story_progression: Narrative beat. Perseus discovers he isn't the first hero Mnemosyne has 'erased'.

areas.description: A tunnel walls lined with sharp, volcanic glass that hums with energy.
areas.story_progression: Perseus uses the Harpe to mine 'Identity Shards' needed to open the way to the Gardens.

areas.description: A room filled with thick, magical smoke that blinds even the 'True Eye'.
areas.story_progression: Perseus must trust his instincts and 'Echo's' voice to find the exit.

areas.description: The walls here are etched with thousands of names that have been forgotten by history.
areas.story_progression: Perseus finds his own name scratched out. Re-etching it with the Harpe boosts his Identity Gauge.

areas.description: A massive door made of pure shadow that leads back to the surface.
areas.story_progression: The exit from the caverns. Perseus uses the stolen eye to 'burn' the shadow door away.

areas.description: A lush, high-altitude garden where every apple glows with internal fire.
areas.story_progression: Perseus must prove his worth to the Hesperides. Failing to show humility causes the apples to burn him.

areas.description: Sheer drops where the wind is strong enough to push a man off his feet.
areas.story_progression: Combat/Traversal challenge. Hermes challenges Perseus to a race. Winning restores the Talaria.

areas.description: A massive, silver-barked tree at the edge of the world.
areas.story_progression: Narrative conclusion of the chapter. Perseus receives the Caduceus Fragment and prepares for the Gorgon fight.

areas.description: A fountain of liquid light that restores both health and memory clarity.
areas.story_progression: Perseus bathes in the spring, clearing the final 'Fisher' fog from his vision of the Gorgon's Lair.

areas.description: An endless field of orange flowers that never wilt. The sun stays on the horizon forever.
areas.story_progression: Andromeda and Perseus share a moment of peace, realizing their journey is almost half over.

areas.description: Floating marble pillars that drift through the clouds. A test of speed and agility.
areas.story_progression: Using the restored Talaria, Perseus learns the 'Sky-Step' ability to reach the upper Gardens.

areas.description: An observatory that looks down on the world of mortals. Everything below looks like a dollhouse.
areas.story_progression: Perseus sees Seriphos in the distance and realizes the village is being swallowed by Titan shadows.

areas.description: Giant, buoyant leaves floating on a sea of clouds. They sink if stood upon for too long.
areas.story_progression: High-speed traversal section where stopping means falling into the 'Void of Forgetfulness'.

areas.description: A path made of condensed mist that solidifies only when Hermes speaks.
areas.story_progression: Hermes explains the Titan's grudge against Zeus, contextualizing why Perseus was targeted.

areas.description: A massive portal flanked by statues of the Four Winds.
areas.story_progression: The transition point to the Gorgon's Peak. Perseus must face Boreas in a final duel of winds.

areas.description: A spiraling path of obsidian that cuts into the clouds.
areas.story_progression: A gauntlet of 'Reflected Enemies' that can only be hit by looking into the Aegis.

areas.description: A cave lined with volcanic glass. Every surface shows a different version of Perseus's life.
areas.story_progression: The encounter with Medusa. It is a parry-focused fight that ends when Perseus refuses to strike the final blow to an image of a woman.

areas.description: The highest point of the mountain, where the air smells of stardust.
areas.story_progression: Pegasus is born. Perseus gains the ability to fly between previously cleared biomes.

areas.description: The mouth of the volcano, where the 'lava' is actually liquefied regrets.
areas.story_progression: Perseus must retrieve a memory shard from the center of the heat, proving his resolve.

areas.description: A field of razor-sharp stone that requires the Helm of Darkness to navigate safely.
areas.story_progression: Perseus learns that stealth can be a weapon, bypassing guardians that are too strong to fight head-on.

areas.description: A flat plain of polished obsidian that acts as a perfect mirror of the sky.
areas.story_progression: Athena appears in the reflection, testing Perseus's tactical mind with a holographic combat challenge.

areas.description: Natural stone pipes that blast hot air upward. Useful for gliding with the Talaria.
areas.story_progression: Advanced aerial combat tutorial using the vents to stay aloft while fighting flying husks.

areas.description: Massive, petrified snakeskins that form tunnels through the mountain.
areas.story_progression: Perseus finds the physical remnants of Medusa’s past, humanizing his victim.

areas.description: A jagged cliff where the statues of failed heroes are piled high.
areas.story_progression: Perseus realizes the Titaness wants him to be just another statue in her collection.

areas.description: A hidden chamber behind a curtain of fire and obsidian.
areas.story_progression: Perseus finds 'Medusa’s Petrified Tear' (item_007), which unlocks the final upgrade for the Aegis.

areas.description: A grand dining hall where everyone has been turned to stone in the middle of a laugh.
areas.story_progression: Perseus explores his old home. He finds the statue of Phineus and realizes his own violent past.

areas.description: A hall showcasing the 'victories' of Polydectes.
areas.story_progression: A mini-boss rush of spectral rivals. Perseus regains his strategic mind (item_015).

areas.description: A high spire overlooking the city of Argos, locked by golden chains.
areas.story_progression: Rescue of Danae. This act of love breaks the Titan's hold on Perseus's empathy.

areas.description: The center of power in Argos, now cold and lifeless.
areas.story_progression: Boss fight with a stone-construct version of Polydectes. Perseus reclaims his right to the throne.

areas.description: A garden where the flowers have turned to iron and the fountain flows with ink.
areas.story_progression: Perseus confronts the ghost of Acrisius, finally forgiving him for casting him into the sea.

areas.description: A room filled with legendary weapons that 'Fisher' is now strong enough to lift.
areas.story_progression: Combat training. The player unlocks the full potential of the Harpe’s true damage stats.

areas.description: A room filled with childhood toys and a small wooden cradle.
areas.story_progression: Narrative beat. Perseus remembers his childhood before the exile, restoring his Identity Gauge to near-full.

areas.description: The deepest part of the palace where Mnemosyne’s influence is strongest.
areas.story_progression: Perseus must find the 'Key of Truth' to open the way to the Sky-Pillar.

areas.description: An overlook where Perseus can see the Atlas Mountains in the distance.
areas.story_progression: Pegasus arrives to take Perseus to the final climb. Andromeda joins him on the journey.

areas.description: A room where the food has turned to ash, symbolizing the Titan’s curse on the land.
areas.story_progression: Perseus uses the Kibisis to 'feed' the hungry phantoms, gaining their blessing for the final battle.

areas.description: An area where the ground falls upward into the sky.
areas.story_progression: Platforming challenge using the Fragment of Atlas to manipulate local gravity.

areas.description: A plateau that is actually the muscular ridge of the Titan Atlas.
areas.story_progression: Dialogue with Atlas. Perseus must prove he understands the weight of consequence.

areas.description: A path of light that only exists as long as Perseus believes it does.
areas.story_progression: The final test of will. If the Identity Gauge is too low, the bridge shatters.

areas.description: A narrow ledge where the player's stamina drains twice as fast.
areas.story_progression: Survival challenge. Perseus must manage his movement efficiently to reach the next safe zone.

areas.description: A canyon where gravity is completely zero. Everything floats aimlessly.
areas.story_progression: Perseus uses the Talaria to navigate the 3D space, fighting 'Sky Husks' in a zero-G dogfight.

areas.description: A rocky outcrop that resembles a massive fist. It shakes periodically.
areas.story_progression: Mini-boss fight against the 'Echo of Atlas', a manifestation of his physical rage.

areas.description: A point so high that the stars appear as massive, burning orbs close by.
areas.story_progression: Narrative beat. Hermes points out the constellations of Perseus and Andromeda, already written in the stars.

areas.description: A path covered in magical ice that freezes the player on contact.
areas.story_progression: Perseus must use the Thunderbolt Shard (item_019) to generate heat and melt the path forward.

areas.description: The literal top of the world. The curvature of the earth is visible.
areas.story_progression: Perseus confronts his fear of godhood. He realizes he can choose to be a man OR a god.

areas.description: A massive rift in the sky that leads to the Titaness's mental sanctuary.
areas.story_progression: Perseus and Pegasus dive into the rift. Transition to the final chapter.

areas.description: The center of the mind-labyrinth where all memories flow.
areas.story_progression: Perseus fights hordes of 'Forgotten Gods' while Mnemosyne narrates his failures.

areas.description: A library of stone tablets containing the history of the world.
areas.story_progression: Narrative reveal of the Titans' plan. Perseus meets the ghost of Glaucus.

areas.description: The absolute core of memory, a white void pulsing with silver light.
areas.story_progression: Final Boss Phase 3. Perseus integrates his divine and mortal selves to end the Titan reign.

areas.description: A tunnel made of shifting scenes from Perseus’s early days in Seriphos.
areas.story_progression: Perseus accepts his 'Fisher' self as just as important as his 'Hero' self.

areas.description: A recreation of every fight Perseus has ever won, but with himself as the enemy.
areas.story_progression: Perseus must 'defeat' his own ego to unlock the True stats of his items.

areas.description: A silent area where thoughts appear as floating text in the air.
areas.story_progression: Mnemosyne’s true motive is revealed: she wanted to be remembered more than any god.

areas.description: A single mirror that reflects Perseus as a god of light.
areas.story_progression: The player chooses the final 'Ascension' buff for the boss fight.

areas.description: A river of silver liquid that flows through the void. It is the blood of memory.
areas.story_progression: Perseus bathes the Harpe in the river, making it powerful enough to kill a Titaness.

areas.description: An area where different versions of history overlap (e.g., Medusa as a human).
areas.story_progression: Perseus sees the world he could have had if he never forgot. He rejects it to return to reality.

areas.display_name: The Portal to the Waking World
areas.description: A bright golden light at the end of the void. The final exit.
areas.story_progression: The game’s ending. Perseus returns to Seriphos, no longer amnesiac, but no longer just 'Fisher'.
